children.subject: <md>I got the same thing too and just reached out to cs-advising. </md>
Oh thank god I had the same thing. Do we still have to reach out to the administration to correct the error?

history.content:
I just received an email saying I have been deemed ineligible to declare the CS major, even though I received an A- in CS 61A, a B in CS 70, and a Pass in CS 61B during Spring 2020. However, I emailed my CS Advisor prior to electing to pass/no pass CS 61B, and was informed that I would still be able to declare the major, as my GPA excluding CS 61B still results in a 3.35.

I only chose to PNP CS 61B after confirming that I could spend time helping my family deal with COVID-19, and extensively checked the guidelines to make sure I can still declare. This email has come as a blow to me, and I'm unsure what to do. Has anyone else received this issue?

~edit~~

It was a clerical error, apparently. If anyone else had this issue, if the math checks out, congratulations! You got the CS Major!
history.subject: CS Major Ineligible?
